answers.answer: Right side pain could be from the liver and gallbladder, the spleen is on the left hand side.Stop drinking the soda "like crazy" you are overloading the kidneys.Going for a pee "at least 100 times a day" is likely to be from drinking the "soda like crazy".  Drinking too much of anything can make you ill, as can if your get dehydrated (not drinking enough).  Limit your liquid consumption to 2-3 litres per day water is the best choice.If you have been very thirsty that is making you drink, this could mean that you may have diabetes.  So if the drinking so much is to quench your thirst you doctor needs to check you out for diabetes.Although you peeing a lot is likely to be because you are drinking "like crazy" you may have a urinary infection.  A doctor can check your urine (pee) with a urine analysis test strip that would show whether or not you have a urinary tract infection.Another cause of your pain could be kidneys.You should make an appointment to see your doctor again so that he can take a blood test to check you out for diabetes and liver and kidney function.  And also to check your urine for any urinary infections.  Your doctor may advise and prescribe for you pain relief medication.You certainly do need further investigation.Let me know how you get on.Best wishes.
